WRITING.TEXT:
'There is no way on board to put someone back in suspension' is inconsistent with 'I'm on a round trip (and will therefore need to be put back in suspension)'. They contradict each other. Plot Hole.
Nope, they put her back in hibernation on the destination planet. Nothing alludes to the fact that the destination planet has not been terra-formed and buildings with science labs already available when they get there, either built by robots send earlier or humans send earlier. Nothing in this movie says that they are going to be the first to set foot on it. So then, she will spend a month on Home2, ask people how life is, then when it was time to return to earth go to one of the specialized science labs with all the equipment needed to properly hibernate a person. No contradiction at all.
As for your suggestions about Jim having tried everything, as far as Jim is concerned and limited by what he knows (nobody knows exactly what they don't know) he did try everything. There is no need to have in depth datasheets and construction manuals for everything on the ship, firstly because most of it will be proprietary and secondly because these manuals and know how will be stored at the construction and maintenance factories.
They have also declared that their cryopods never malfunction. Yet they did, twice in one trip!! Maybe beleive the hype a little less. :-)
This was the first time, so in actual fact when Jim boarded the ship the statement that no pod malfunctioned was technically correct. Up to that point in time there never was any failure made known. Perhaps there were and they kept it silent because nobody would be all that concerned that their great, great, great uncle Jim died on a space trip 180 years ago.

Agree, and I think that when applying to go on this trip you need to go through a couple of extensive medicals that include psycho analyses to weed out the crazies. Given how thorough and quickly one of this pods can give an analysis on a person's health, the only thing that could cause medical emergencies are if people fell of high floors and broke a bone, or cut themselves with sharp objects. All really stuff that you can not plan for but that should not really happen. and if it did, it would be on the scale of perhaps 1 person per 20 trips or so.

Thing is 2.7 Kelvin is pretty damn cold and it being mostly empty *space* would imply that there is more than enough *space* in which to dissipate in to.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Outer_space
Agreed, Solaris did this pretty well.
Hence the term thought experiment.

It says she went from hating him to loving him in like a day.
Where? Who said this?
Actually dying by poison which causes you to become unconscious would be a lot more peaceful than suffocating while still fully aware of yourself.

Man it must've been lonely as fuck during old age after one of them died.
Sad thing is, this actually happens now with old couples that have been together and in love for most of their lives. When one goes, the other follows in a span of a few years max. Just look at what happened to Debbie Reynolds after losing her daughter Carrie Fisher recently.

Great point, that could have worked. Alternating with five years in, five years out, would have caused them to age by 45 years. Assuming they are currently 30 years old, they would have been 75 upon arrival.
So, to be safe not to die from old age, they could not really spent a significant amount of time with both outside, perhaps a couple of months max at a time.
The thing is however that the older you get the less important death becomes, as you realize that living consists out of a lot more than just not dying...
Possibly, but then they could have asked the barman droid to do it.

but more likely the writers goofed.
Excellent reply, I also think the writers didn't do their homework on this one.

Don't agree with this, if you found the right partner, eternity is too short.
Also see my reply above to PhillyJawn91.

Difficult to say, I think she realized that by Jim waking her up, he *accidentally* saved her life when the ship started going crazy.
Then when she faced the possible reality of having to be alone on the ship for decades to come, due to Jim not surviving opening the door from the outside; she came to the realization of what he possibly went through in the first year. This makes forgiving him easier.
Furthermore once they started creating a completely new life on the ship together, having access to the best food, drink and entertainment (via the master pass override), it is not so easy to just say goodbye knowing that your partner of 30+ years will have to now live in utter solitude, suffer at the end of their life and die all alone.
In Aurora's back story it is also mentioned that she is a bit of loner that seeks to find something to fill that empty void on the inside. Who knows, perhaps loving and living with Jim filled the void.
Thoroughly enjoyed it as well. Love good semi plausible Sci-Fi movies, pity there aren't many of them though.
Thanks for the detailed reply, much appreciated.

WRITING.TITLE: ESO non Steam account upgraded to Morrowind, can I link this upgraded account to a Steam copy of the base game?

WRITING.TEXT:
Google for the Minion app. It allows easy installation of all mods right from the app. You can also filter to show only mods that are up to date (most good useful ones are now).
Sort all new mods by amount downloaded and see if it is something you would like. Install it with Minion and enjoy.

The initial levels comes so fast that you need to be really lucky to get perfect gear. When you get to the twenties it will start tapering of and you will need more kills to get to the next level which means you get much more loot in between levels.
But the charge depletes.

Running the right set of skills with gear optimised to complement these skills makes a huge difference.
At CP level 200+ you should be moving through the CP 160 normal mobs.

The only professions that will have a direct influence that cannot be bought at a guild trader, on how you fight monsters are alchemy and provisioning. This is because alchemy enhance duration and power of potions you drink and provisioning enhance duration of meals and drink.
All other profession's end products can be bought from other players or guild traders. Although the most powerful sets are very expensive.
I use ESO+ only for the crafting bag. It would be impossible for me to play the game without it. If you have it, all crafting materials from all profesions gathered by all your characters go into this endless bag. You can farm and mine all day long without adding one item to your inventory. All of it goes into this bag.

If you are level 47 now, get yourself some xp increasing potions from the crown store or a guild vendor. Queue for dungeons. As soon as the dungeon ready pops drink the potion. It should take about four dungeons to get to max.
The first 100 CP points comes very quickly (like getting from level 1 to 25 about). Get these first 100 CP points. Any new alt will have a much quicker kill speed with the CP points correctly spend.
Yeah, I use Votan's minimap add on. This displays the in game time. Whenever I see that it is close to sunrise or sunset I start looking for these rays. The game engine really does it well.
If you haven't yet done it ensure to not read or watch any spoilers. Let the game deliver the feels with the superb voice acting.
Agree with you, also being CP 500 on their main makes all content on the speed leveled alt trivial.

You will be doing yourself a disfavor by speeding to max level on your first play through. This MMO is very different from most others in that the journey to max level is very enjoyable. All quest dialog is voiced. You can also run dungeons with level 50 characters as soon as you hit level 10.
You don't need to be max level to start playing current content. All content is current due to the level scaling technology.

Seriously doubt if it is possible. Steam uses a special encrypted file format for all the games as well as a specially modified executable that understands how to decrypt these files.
Sometimes just copying a Steam directory over directly doesn't even work. You need to use the Steam backup to DVD functionality to share a game with a friend. This friend then needs to import the backup Steam files into his Steam library. This importing encrypts the files again.

Like the other well informed player mentioned, it is very important to ensure that you level all your class skills to 50 while still leveling.
You level a skill line by just having that skill on your bar, you don't even have to use it (of course putting a semi useful skill from each of your class skills will be beneficial). This way when another patch with nerfs and buffs come around you will be ready.
Don't worry to much about doing crazy damage on your way to level 50. It is more important to get there with all class skill trees, bow and duel wield at level 50. Even if you felt a bit gimped by the skills on your bar.
Remember to switch to the bar with the skills most in need of a level up before handing in a quest as the xp from this is huge and will boost all skill trees represented on the current active bar.
The real journey starts once you hit level 50. By being level 50 and around CP 100 you should now have all required skills maxed out and morphed. Now the real fun starts as you grind to CP 160 and max your crafting skills.
Once you hit CP 160 you can now wear the highest level armor and use the most powerful weapons in the game. At this point you will have a good understanding of the class and what you enjoy. At this point you will start to gear specifically for your skill set and role.
The real game (at least the most MMO portion) starts only once you hit CP 160
tl;dr get all skill lines to level 50 before the actual game starts once you hit CP 160

Yeah, the number one is not prime. Mainly due to the following being possible 1 = 1 x 1 x 1...
So a prime is a number *greater* than one divisible only by itself and one.
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_number

Yeah man questing in the The Rift has some real emotional quests.

Very insightful.
You win the interwebz today.

If you're scares of carrying noobs, don't queue for random veteran.

WRITING.TITLE: Great view with the sun through the trees from the top of this tower.

WRITING.TEXT: Definitely, there should be more players like you ;)

Agree with you, however 9 out of 10 times you don't even get the opportunity to prove yourself due to getting removed from the group and ending up with a 15 minute debuf.
Thing is for most of us, time is a precious resource. Getting this debuf means that the person may end up not running any dungeon (normal or vet) that evening.
It is bad for the game, and can be easily resolved.

WRITING.TITLE: With regards to dungeons and queuing pretty please:
WRITING.TEXT:
Implement either of the following:
1. Make the DEFAULT dungeon that one may queue for normal mode until at least CP 160. 2. Remove the option to queue for veteran dungeons until at least CP 160. 3. Remove the debuff of 15 minutes when kicked within the first 30 seconds of the group being ported into the dungeon.
I understand that CP 160+ players already did the leg work to get decent gear and CP levels, I really don't blame them for kicking CP 20 players.
However, I have a problem with the implementation of this. Veteran dungeons are like heroic and mythic dungeons in WoW. In WoW you must be a minimum item level even to queue for heroic or mythic dungeons. This ensures that when pugging a dungeon high level players do not need to carry low level players.
The problem in ESO is that at soon as you hit level 50 CP 0 the DEFAULT when queuing for dungeons is veteran difficulty. Now there is no way a 4 CP 0 players can clear these dungeons in a reasonable amount of time. If they group up with three CP 200 players and they are DPS, I seriously doubt they will even do 5% of the total damage, and even worse, some bosses will just sneeze at them and they will die from it. Also due to the low CP level they are not familiar with the tactics in the boss fights which can cause the whole group to wipe over and over.
So, the CP 200 players (well within their right) kick the newly dinged CP 0 player when entering the dungeon, but now the CP 0 player sits with a 15 minute debuff.
So hence the above recommendations that should be a QoL improvement for all.

It could be a myriad of other factors
Exactly, by letting ZOS know about the issue, they might get a fix for it. If nobody does anything and everyone just accepts the latency and disconnects as normal, they would not spend as much effort on it to get it resolved compared to if we let them knew about it.

You haven't played very MMOs then.
I only play the good ones.I played WoW from 2010 and SWTOR from 2013. And now ESO from 2016.
I am not bashing the game or ZOS guys, I just want to know why I am not experiencing these issues with WoW or SWTOR?
If ZOS can resolve this by moving to another ISP or adding more hardware and the issue is resolved for everybody, wouldn't that be good?
Thanks, will give it a shot.

WRITING.TITLE: New it was only a question of time!

WRITING.TEXT:
Exactly, we are the universe becoming self aware of it self and learning how it came into being (big bang) and its own eminent demise when after trillions of years everything cools down so much that there are literately no more energy left at all in the universe.
Individuals committing suicide for what ever perceived or real to them reason is unfortunately part of this journey.
Very well put. I share a similar view.

what? you mean that the void is sad?... that makes no sense
No, but the void is nothingness. We as humans are the universe attempting to explain itself. The fact that we have evolved over millions of years on a rocky planet in the Goldilocks zone of star; and then have the privilege to philosophise over what exactly the universe is trying to learn by discussing suicide, is reason enough to live without self imposed bounds as if everyday *may* be the last. But yet it isn't...
Drugs, watching TV, eating fast foods, in essence also committing suicide, just at a very slow rate.
The problem with suicide is that it is a permanent solution to what may be a temporary problem.

So we are triplets then!
I am on PC EU
Scary
Cool
Absolutely fascinating universe we have the privilege of existing in, thanks for taking the time to explain this in detail, much appreciated.

Thanks, so basically you are saying that a positron and a proton then will have the exact same potential although the positron is very very much smaller than the proton? And the proton needs three other particles combined to have the same potential as one point particle?
How can a positron contain so much potential and yet be only a point particle?

Thanks for the thorough reply, it makes more sense now. Difficult to wrap one's mind around some of this stuff though, for example as you say an electron is a point particle not made up of anything else.
So, how then is it possible for one electron with a negative charge of (just using an example here) -1 when a proton which is much, much larger needs 3 thingies inside it (quarks) to give it the same power but with an opposite charge of +1.
Yet a positron which I then assume would also be a point particle the size of an electron is able to have a charge of +1.
Or do you need to put several electrons together before they have the same electrical potential as one proton?
Also, you mention angular momentum as a fixed attribute. What exactly are the protons spinning around?
P.S. Thanks for the Star Wars reference in your answer :)
Thanks, appreciate the reply.

WRITING.TITLE: ELI5:What exactly makes an electron negative and a proton positive and why are they seen as complete opposites? How do this relate to antimatter?
WRITING.TEXT:
Hi all
Subject has a couple of questions but they all (at least according to my limited knowledge) refer to the same thing. What exactly is negative and what is positive at a fundamental level?
Why is an electron negative and an anti-electron positive, what exactly determines this.
Is it impossible for something else to exist that is not negative, positive or neutral?
What is charge? What exactly makes an electron to have a negative charge and a proton to have a positive charge? Does charge have a weight? Are there things smaller than an electron inside an electron configured in a certain way that makes it negative? And these things are arranged / move in an opposite direction in an anti-electron (positron) to make it positive?
How can a positron contain the same amount of electrical potential, but it is a point object the same size as an electron, where as a proton, which is very much larger needs three sub particles in order to have the same potential? How is charge saved in the positron?

Got mine on my third crate opened.
Perhaps *random* is not *really* all that random...

Edit: I now own a Chub Loon.
How?

Yes, I am in a metric system country. However most petroleum refineries in my country were build by American engineering houses. All of them used ASME design codes (thus flange ratings of 150 PSI or 600 PSI etcetera) and ASME + API + AWWA materials for, for instance piping isometric drawings.
This resulted that all the drawings used pipe diameter in inch, but pipe length in millimeter. So the refineries use a mixed metric system.
In schools and universities we only use metric though.
So in theory something can become *infinitely* hot?

Good day, thanks for your reply, it is much appreciated.
I understand the notion of charge and that charge can be negative or positive.
*But what is charge?* What exactly makes an electron to have a negative charge and a proton to have a positive charge? Does charge have a weight? Are there things smaller than an electron inside an electron configured in a certain way that makes it negative? And these things are arranged / move in an opposite direction in an anti-electron (positron) to make it positive?
Not exactly sure how to express my question.
It is going to be awesome.

Respect for putting in the effort to self teach yourself this.
Yeah, DSP and its variants makes up a huge portion of the curriculum, in an electrical engineering degree.

No, the *rate of increase in distance* between two points in space are not limited to the speed of light. it can and does exceed the speed of light.
If we are holding two torches with their back sides to each other so that the lenses point in the opposite direction of each other, and then switch both torches on at the same time. From this one would seem to imply that in one second, the distance between two photons , one from each torch, are now 2 x Speed of light traveled in one second apart from each other. Hence they traveled faster than the speed of light But assuming that would be incorrect, what did actually happen was that the rate of increase in distance was twice the speed of light; each photon still only traveled at the speed of light, and Einstein's special relativity still holds. Photons and anything else that want to move at the speed of light are very special in the sense that they have no initial reference frame where they were stationary. As soon as they come into existence they are traveling at exactly the speed of light, no acceleration needed. When you look up at a very distant star, the photon left that star billions of light years ago according to your frame of reference, but for the photon's frame of reference the time needed to travel from the star to your eye was instantaneous - 0 seconds. Time does not exist for photons. Weird right. One should be really careful when talking about stuff moving at the speed of light as it is extremely easily to find oneself in a myriad of these faster than light paradoxes.

Right? If two people move opposite directions at the speed of light, what is the distance between them after an hour?
They can't it is impossible. You will need an infinite force to get any object with mass to go at the speed of light.
If we change your statement slightly by saying we are holding two torches with their back sides to each other so that the lenses point in the opposite direction of each other, and then switch both torches on at the same time.
From this one would seem to imply that in one second, the distance between two photons , one from each torch, are now 2 x Speed of light traveled in one second apart from each other. *Hence they traveled faster than the speed of light* But assuming that would be incorrect, what did actually happen was that the rate of increase in distance was twice the speed of light; each photon still only traveled at the speed of light, and Einstein's special relativity still holds. Photons and anything else that want to move at the speed of light are very special in the sense that they have no initial reference frame where they were stationary. As soon as they come into existence they are traveling at exactly the speed of light, no acceleration needed.
When you look up at a very distant star, the photon left that star billions of light years ago according to your frame of reference, but for the photon's frame of reference the time needed to travel from the star to your eye was instantaneous - 0 seconds. Time does not exist for photons. Weird right.
One should be really careful when talking about stuff moving at the speed of light as it is extremely easily to find oneself in a myriad of these faster than light paradoxes.
I happen to find myself in this exact same first world problem as well.
